sub_title: Quality Engineering | New and Existing Client Relationships | Financial Services Transformation
summary:
Partha is an experienced account management and business development professional. He has managed both new account acquisition and client relationships with emphasis on growth in existing accounts. He has worked in multiple sales roles, industry verticals, technology horizontals, geographies and multi-cultural teams selling and delivering solutions on application development and management services, testing services, consulting and infrastructure services.

In a career spanning more than 27 years, Partha has worked in multiple sales roles. A Mechanical Engineer by qualification he started his career in 1994 in India on engineering design of steam and gas turbines with DLF Energy Systems. However, he moved to a pure sales role in an industrial pump company Roto Pumps Limited and subsequently moved to IT sales in 1998 with CMC Limited (which has now been merged with TATA consultancy Services). He worked with CMC till mid 2011 in various sales roles (Business Development Manager, Regional Manager – UK & Ireland, Strategic Relationship Manager) including a 4 year stint in the UK from 2007-2010 when he was instrumental in winning deals at several Banking, Insurance and Utility companies and also at a Public Sector organization in Northern Ireland. He also managed relationships for these clients.

In 2011, Partha moved back to India from UK and joined IBM as Territory Manager responsible for all of IBM’s business (hardware, software and services) in the countries of Bangladesh, Nepal and Bhutan while leading a team of direct reports and business partners. IBM focussed mainly on the Banking and Telecom sectors in these geos.

In mid 2013 Partha joined Capgemini as an Account Executive for the Utilities sector at Capgemini Netherlands where he handled several large customer accounts. He then moved to Financial Services in mid 2015 and managed a portfolio of accounts in the Insurance & Pensions vertical for the Benelux region.

In September 2017 Partha moved from Capgemini to Infosys and is currently responsible for driving sales and revenue of Infosys Quality Engineering and Testing services for the Insurance Market in the UK & Europe. He brings in an innovation led approach with focus on emerging trends, automation and unified technology-consulting viewpoints for his clients.

school.name: Malaviya National Institute of Technology Jaipur

profile_positions.description: Managing sales of Infosys Validation Services (QE & Testing) for the Insurance Market in UK & Europe. Key responsibilities include overall business development, advising clients on QE transformation initiatives and manage client relationships. The role also entails internally managing a synchronous relationship with client partners on the one hand as well as delivery teams on the other with stakeholders located onsite, nearshore and offshore.
profile_positions.title: Senior Practice Director - Client Services

profile_positions.description:
While at Capgemini, Partha worked in the Insurance & Pensions MDU under the Financial Services SBU of Capgemini Benelux managing several large accounts. Prior to that up to mid 2015, he was part of the Energy & Utilities Segment team under Application Services Business Unit of Netherlands managing several accounts. 

Insurers’ operating and business models are evolving, driven by trends such as disaggregation of the insurance value chain, new product opportunities and focus on differentiation in the market. Insurance distribution is being redefined by new technologies such as chatbots, digital tools that are creating more market transparency and growth of direct channels in the small business market. New technologies such as Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence and Robotics Process Automation have the potential to streamline insurers’ operations and enhance customer experience. Partha is well aware and in sync with the developing trends in the market and has used his knowledge and experience to gain trust of his customers and develop business for Capgemini.  Partha was also completely aligned with the current structure of the Netherlands Business Unit in terms of the Local & Global Business Lines and maintained excellent relationship with Capgemini internal teams both in the Netherlands and India, relevant divisions being Digital Customer Experience (DCX) & Mobility, Insights & Data, Cloud, Domains and Application Development, Management and Testing.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: Partha led the territory (with primary responsibility to expand and grow IBM’s market share, revenue and profit across all lines of business (all hardware & software products and infrastructure services). He also managed a highly motivated direct and indirect sales and support team with a strong focus on customer satisfaction. This included working with territory distribution channels for product and solution delivery. He defined and coordinated with marketing teams for the right events & customer reach programs to help meet territory objectives. As a part of his people management responsibilities, he coached his team to develop client value propositions and clearly identify financial and business benefits to IBM clients.
profile_positions.title: Territory Leader - Bangladesh, Nepal and Bhutan

profile_positions.description: After returning from the UK in 2011 due to family reasons, Partha started working as a Strategic Relationship Manager for a few key accounts in Eastern India. His focus was sales and revenue for CMC's core areas of expertise – Infrastructure Services, Application Development and Maintenance, IT Enabled Services from accounts in the Utilities and Public sector. He also worked on refining internal processes in line with Tata Business Excellence Model requirements.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Relationship Manager

profile_positions.description: Partha worked as a Regional Manager for CMC Informatics UK, which was the UK branch of CMC Limited, India (now merged with TATA Consultancy Services). He was responsible for sales and revenue covering CMC's focus areas in the UK & Ireland – Infrastructure Services, Application Services, Professional Services and IT Enabled Services. He worked in Energy & Utilities, Manufacturing and Government verticals. In line with CMC’s go-to-market model for the UK, Partha aligned with the industry verticals and account teams of TATA Consultancy Services (its parent company) to acquire and nurture clients in the mentioned verticals driving both sales and revenue. He handled multiple roles here – sales, bid and contract management, partner and vendor management as well as Branch Operations (Home Office, Legal, HR, Financial Controls) which was a first for him.
profile_positions.title: Regional Manager, United Kingdom & Ireland

profile_positions.description:
Partha worked as a Business Development Manager in India to grow CMC’s business in areas of:
•	System Integration and Application Development & Maintenance 
•	IT Infrastructure Services
•	BPO and IT Enabled Services
He headed business development and account management teams for ITeS business in the east and northeastern regions of India. He provided pre sales and project support for five projects worth multi million dollars for a USA client that CMC won in synergy with TCS.
He also provided support to international teams in USA, UK and Middle East for BPO and ITeS solutions primarily in Energy & Utilities, Banking and Financial Services, Manufacturing, Telecom and Public Sector verticals.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
A few highlights:
•	Bagged Runners up Award for Best Marketing Executive all India.
•	Handled installation of nine heavy-duty industrial pumps in Upper Assam, India for a customer in the Oil sector & collected payment thereafter.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Executive
